MAN.TITLE: imread

PARAM_ITEM.PARAM_DESCRIPTION: A string, the image filename to be read. The extension determines the type of the image.
All images will be converted to gray images or RGB images. For gray images, this is a MxN unsigned char matrix; For RGB images, this is a MxNx3 unsigned char matrix.

DESCRIPTION.P: imread reads many types of image files into Scilab. The format of the file is inferred from the extension in the filename parameter. Currently the following file formats are supported:

DESCRIPTION_INDENT.DESCRIPTION_ITEM: * Portable image format - PBM, PGM, PPM;

reads image in filename into im matrix. If filename contains a truecolor image, im is a MxNx3 hypermatrix, so for example im(:,:,1) stands for the red channel. For gray images, im is a MxNx1 unsigned char matrix.

SECTION.label: Bugs and Shortcomings
SECTION.P: Images with a palette are not supported. All kinds of images are converted to gray images or RGB images.
